title: Basic Checkmates
description: Learn essential checkmate patterns with limited material

lessons.title: Queen and King vs King
lessons.description: Deliver checkmate with queen and king

alternatives.feedback: Qd2+ also works but takes longer. Go for the quickest mate
Don't move the king away. Use the queen to drive the enemy king to the edge
This doesn't give check. Force the king toward the edge with check

lessons.hint: Give check to force the black king to the edge of the board
lessons.explanation: Qd1+ forces the black king to move, driving it toward the edge where checkmate will be easier to achieve. The key is to systematically reduce the enemy king's space.

lessons.title: Rook and King vs King
lessons.description: Checkmate with rook and king - cut off the king

alternatives.feedback: Rh2+ gives check but isn't mate. Look for the finishing move
Moving the king doesn't help. Use your rook to deliver mate
This cuts off escape but isn't checkmate yet

lessons.hint: The black king is trapped. Deliver checkmate with your rook
lessons.explanation: Rd1# is checkmate! The black king has no escape squares - the white king controls the escape squares, and the rook delivers mate on the back rank.

lessons.title: Two Rooks vs King
lessons.description: Use the ladder technique to deliver mate

alternatives.feedback: This doubles rooks but doesn't give check. Be more forcing
Rh3+ works but the ladder technique with Ra2+ is more systematic
This doesn't give check. Use the ladder technique

lessons.hint: Use one rook to give check and drive the king up the board
lessons.explanation: Ra2+ forces the black king to move up the board. The 'ladder' technique involves alternating rook checks to systematically drive the king to the edge.

lessons.title: Bishop and Knight Mate
lessons.description: Force the king to the corner with the same color as your bishop

alternatives.feedback: Nd4 is good but doesn't cut off as many squares as Bd3
King moves are important but use your pieces to control key squares first
Bf5 doesn't help drive the king toward the dark-squared corner

lessons.hint: Control the key central squares to restrict the black king's movement
lessons.explanation: Bd3 controls important central squares and works with the knight to drive the king toward the h8 corner (same color as the bishop). This is a complex but beautiful mate pattern.

lessons.title: King and Pawn vs King
lessons.description: Promote your pawn while keeping the enemy king at bay

alternatives.feedback: Kb3 allows Ka3, blocking your pawn. Keep the enemy king away
Kd3 doesn't support the pawn's advance as directly
Going backward loses time. Advance with your king

lessons.hint: Support your pawn's advance by keeping the enemy king away from it
lessons.explanation: Kc3 supports the pawn's advance to c4, c5, etc. The key principle is that your king must stay in front of the pawn to clear the path to promotion.
